messages.message:
What changes should Israel make to its demands, especially now after it has taken control of the Rafah crossing?

I am convinced that everyone aware of the situation in the Gaza war knows Hamas's main demands that it's unwilling to compromise on for the release of the hostages:

First and foremost - stopping the war entirely. 

After that - the withdrawal of IDF forces from the Gaza Strip, the return of the displaced, and the restoration of the Gaza Strip.

Then, and only then - a "serious" prisoner swap deal.

And what does Israel want? Only the release of the hostages? 
Why is Hamas's list so long and marketed so well? Each such demand line from Hamas is published and reiterated non-stop by officials and representatives, which only strengthens each of the demands individually as bargaining chips in the negotiations. Israel has to give something to meet each of Hamas's long list of demands.

Does Israel only want the release of hostages? That's it? Why?

Over the past few months, the US has been urging Israel to make decisions on "the day after the war." This was crucial to them. Israel was publicly reprimanded, even creating internal political conflict.

Now, the time has come for Israel to turn to the Americans, who are urging it with all their might to reach an agreement and ask about the day after the war.

What will happen to senior Hamas officials? What will happen to Hamas's weapons?

Just as Hamas announces several times a day in every possible media outlet that its threshold condition for a deal is a permanent ceasefire, Israel should now demand as a threshold condition for any future agreement the removal of senior Hamas officials from the Strip and the disarmament of Hamas.

This is a logical, basic, important condition, one that the US will have a hard time saying no to, which can lead to the full and real end of the war, even if the IDF does not eliminate all of Hamas's militants in the Strip (complete elimination is probably an unrealistic goal).

Such a condition would prevent Hamas from claiming victory. The winners are never exiled.

The US can and should agree to such a condition - it will allow it to create new leadership in Gaza for the day after the war. As long as senior Hamas officials are not expelled from the Strip and as long as Hamas is not disarmed, it is irrelevant to talk about "the day after" in the Strip.

Hamas will not just peacefully allow a foreign power (Israel, the US, Saudi Arabia, or anyone else...) to replace them as the ruling force in the Gaza Strip with someone else. The exile of Hamas's leaders is a necessary step, as mentioned, towards ending the war.

Israel should start demanding that the exile of Hamas and its disarmament are threshold conditions for any future ceasefire deal! Only then can we commit to ending the war, and it would even help Biden reach a normalization deal with Saudi Arabia before the November elections...

The Egyptian Foreign Ministry condemns the operation in Rafah. But what does it really mean?

The Egyptian Ministry of Foreign Affairs: 

"We strongly condemn the Israeli actions in Rafah and the takeover of the Palestinian side of the Rafah crossing. Egypt sees this as a risk to the lives of more than a million Palestinians who rely on the crossing. We call on Israel to exercise maximum restraint and "stay away from the edge of the precipice" - as it harms the efforts to reach a Hudna.

###
An untrained reader might wrongly think that Egypt truly opposes an Israeli military action in Rafah. I mean, it strongly condemned it...

But if we dig a little deeper, translate it into "spoken Middle Eastern", and read between the lines - there is no threat of concrete actions from the Egyptian side, no threat to trade agreements, or diplomatic relations, and certainly not to the peace agreements between the two countries.  

Egypt calls on Israel to exercise maximum restraint... This translates to - When you take down Hamas in Rafah, do it in a way that won't make us look bad. After all, we're not really doing anything to prevent you from doing so, but we still need to maintain our image as one of the leading countries in the Arab world...

The al-Sisi regime, which despises the Muslim Brotherhood and its Palestinian branch - Hamas, would be more than happy to see Hamas disappear from its border.

Meanwhile, there are quite a few complaints among Gazans on social media: Where has the Egyptian army gone? They're doing nothing to prevent Israel from acting in Rafah...

##
To summarize, the Egyptians are not that excited, and Hamas has not stopped the ceasefire talks. Now we understand just how idle all the threats to prevent a military operation in Rafah were.

This is an important lesson for the coming months of the war.

Fatah supporters on Facebook mock Hamas by publishing a "newly-updated list" (instead of the existing one planned for today) of those approved to leave Gaza through the Rafah crossing today, which includes the following Israeli names:

messages.message:
Washington CNN —President Joe Biden on Tuesday issued a call to fight a swiftly rising tide of antisemitism amid a precarious moment in Israel’s war against Hamas and as protests have swept American college campuses, laying bare Biden’s trouble with some young voters.
Biden’s longtime and stalwart support for Israel has come under intense pressure as the humanitarian crisis in Gaza grows.
The protests are not expected to be a major part of the speech, the official added.
However, Biden did not intend to use his speech on Tuesday to delve into Middle East policy or the current situation in Israel or Gaza.
Biden worked with his core speech writing team and senior advisers on Tuesday’s speech, offering direct input and language as the draft has come together.

President Joe Biden arrives at Andrews Air Force Base, Md., from a weekend trip to his Delaware home, Monday, May 6, 2024.
Advertisement Article continues below this adThe Capitol event, hosted by the U.S.
Advertisement Article continues below this adThe Department of Homeland Security was moving to educate schools and community groups about resources and funding available to promote campus safety and address threats.
And the State Department’s special envoy to monitor and combat antisemitism was meeting with technology companies on how to combat the rise in hateful conflict online.
Trump’s campaign on Monday released a video on Yom Hashoah, Israel’s Holocaust remembrance day, that aimed to contrast the 2024 presidential candidates’ responses on antisemitism.

Washington — President Biden is delivering the keynote address at the U.S.
President Biden delivers a speech at the Commander-In-Chief's Trophy Event at the White House in Washington D.C., United States on May 6, 2024.
Some of the demonstrations have featured antisemitic rhetoric that has prompted concerns about the safety of Jewish students on campuses.
"We must protect our Jewish students and we must give our full-throated unequivocal support to the nation of Israel," Johnson said.
In his remarks on Tuesday, Mr. Biden is expected to focus on the administration's efforts to protect Jewish Americans from antisemitism.

messages.message:
They don’t want to irritate anybody, but they’re tolerating hate speech,” Miriam Borvick, a first-year medical student at UNLV, said.
Protesters wrapped in Israeli flags rally against antisemitism on Monday at UNLV.
The biggest message from Monday’s rally was that the Jewish community won’t stand for antisemitism on college campuses.
Posters prepared for Monday’s anti-semitism rally at UNLV.
While no counter-protesters showed up Monday, David said there was a difference between Monday’s rally and the one on May 1.

By Euronews with ATORFSince the start of the Israel-Hamas war, Austria has seen a rise in antisemitic incidents.
The president of the lower house of the Austrian Parliament, Wolfgang Sobotka, is attempting to counter them in ViennaADVERTISEMENTThe Jewish Community in Austria has reported a rise in antisemitic incidents across the country.
In response, National Council President Wolfgang Sobotka, along with Israel's Ambassador to Austria David Roet and President of the Israelite Religious Society Austria Oskar Deutsch, took action by painting over the graffiti in Vienna-Leopoldstadt, the heart of Jewish life in Austria.
Under the leadership of Austrian Constitutional Minister Karoline Edtstadler, the third European Conference on Antisemitism is taking place in Vienna on 6 and 7 May.
The opening session features remarks from President of the Austrian Academy of Sciences Heinz Faßmann and Federal Minister Edtstadler.

The University of Chicago campus police department early Tuesday began ordering students to leave an encampment that had been the site of Pro-Palestinian protests since last week.
Around 6 a.m., Fazio reported Cook County Sherriff's Deputies were present on city streets.
Encampment raided by campus police at University of Chicago.
The Tuesday response from university police comes a day after officials at the University of Chicago said talks between protesters and the school were "suspended."
"In particular, the Scholars at Risk program is an existing initiative at the University of Chicago and other leading universities and colleges.

messages.message:
Knesset Christian Allies Caucus, MK Matan Kahana, in collaboration with the Israel Allies Foundation, joined the March of Life movement in Stuttgart on Holocaust Remembrance Day on May 6.
This year’s Remembrance Day fell just over half a year after over 1200 people were killed by Hamas, the largest numbers of Jews to be killed on a single day since the Holocaust.
The Israel Allies Foundation, founded in 2007, works to educate and empower pro-Israel, faith-based legislators worldwide.
The IAF coordinates the work of 53 Israel Allies Caucuses internationally.
This network includes the Knesset Christian Allies Caucus, the Congressional Israel Allies Caucus, and the European Union Parliamentary Israel Allies Caucus.

New curriculum guidance on Holocaust education for kindergarten to Grade 11 students will be rolled out during the next school year, following up on the premier's pledge to make learning about the atrocities of World War II mandatory in the province.
"The Jewish community has been asking for mandated Holocaust education for more than half a century," said Belle Jarniewski, executive director of the Jewish Heritage Centre of Western Canada.
Jarniewski also said having mandatory Holocaust education is important, especially with a rise in antisemitism since the start of the ongoing war between Israel and Hamas.
Jewish Federation CEO Jeff Lieberman said in Monday's new release Holocaust education in Manitoba will empower young people in the province to "stand up against antisemitism and hatred in all its forms."
Human Rights education bus begins tour in WinnipegA human rights education bus is also touring through Winnipeg this week and made a stop at Shaftesbury High School Monday.

Two UW–Madison student groups have been suspended on an interim basis while the university investigates allegations of sidewalk chalkings by the groups that endorsed violence, supported terrorist organizations and were antisemitic, the university announced Monday.
Mecha de UW Madison and Anticolonial Scientists were suspended after UW’s Committee on Student Organizations received complaints and media reports Sunday and Monday about the chalking event at the Dane County Farmers’ Market in Downtown Madison on Saturday.
The suspension also bars them from using university-owned office space, hosting or co-hosting events, travel and reserving university facilities.
Other chalkings said “Power to Hezbollah,” “Down with ‘Israel’ down with ‘USA’” and “All cops are Zionists,” the newspaper reported.
“Our only goal and the only goal of the event is to support Palestine and Palestinian liberation,” he said.

The suspension also bars them from using university-owned office space, hosting or co-hosting events, travel and reserving university facilities.
Other chalkings said “Power to Hezbollah,” “Down with ‘Israel’ down with ‘USA’” and “All cops are Zionists," the newspaper reported.
Mecha de UW Madison did not immediately respond to an email seeking comment and the person who answered the group's phone number said she was no longer part of the group.

messages.message:
Christian Family Radio (CFR) invited members of the community to stand in solidarity with the Jewish Community against antisemitism.
The protestors marched up and down Scottsville Road three times, symbolizing the six million lost during the Holocaust.
As the protestors marched the lengths of the roadside, cars passing by shared their support through a string of honks.
I hope that there is no need for a march next year, because world peace will have come.
May the Messiah have come and brought world peace, and may there be no more antisemitism,” said Upton.

New York’s Xavier High School is seeking to tackle this problem through their innovative new Holocaust studies program, a voluntary, non-class program spanning an entire semester.
Xavier’s Holocaust Studies program has the power to help prevent people from developing these hateful and ill-informed views towards other human beings, in part by driving home the pain such groups went through.
The entire reason history is taught is so students can learn from the past to forge a better future.
The algorithms behind these social media sites have one goal: to keep the user’s attention.
This situation is the core of what Xavier’s new Holocaust studies program aims to address.

Rain falls on the encampment on May 3, 2024.
This is the fifth day of the growing pro-Palestine encampment demonstration, which now fills most of space between Lillis Business Complex and Knight Library; the protest is one of many across college campuses nationwide.
(Alex Hernandez/Emerald)

98e43fd2-e62e-4de5-8e48-c99c72960a34.location: Lillis Business Complex and Knight Library

messages.message:
In honor of Yom HaShoah, Holocaust Memorial Day, 1,200 Israeli flags were planted, representing the Israeli lives lost on Oct. 7.
On Yom HaShoah, Holocaust Memorial Day, Binghamton University’s Zionist Organization (BUZO) created a Display of Remembrance on the Peace Quad.
The rally was held during the second day of the Peace Quad encampment organized by the Divest from Death coalition, which was disassembled before 5 p.m. last Friday.
Hakim said they chose to put the memorial on the Peace Quad partly because of the encampment’s presence there.
“It’s important that all of us want peace,” Hakim said.
